static void listenOnPort (int port)
 Listen on a UDP port and echo everything that comes in.

Detailed Description

A trivial program for echoing all the UDP packets that come to a port. To run it:
<xmp> javac echoUDP.java java echoUDP <portnum> </xmp>
where typically <portnum> will be 514 (syslog port).

This program is useful for getting the logging output from the IPDR client (trasnmitter) when you don't have a syslog facility available and you don't want to be bothered with installing something fancier on your machine.

The output is one line per UDP packet, with the line being prefixed by the machine that the packet came from.

Member Function Documentation

static void echoUDP::listenOnPort (  int  port  )  [inline, static, private]
 

Listen on a UDP port and echo everything that comes in. 

00051                                                {
00052 
00053         System.err.println("Listening on port " + port);
00054 
00055         try {
00056             DatagramSocket socket = new DatagramSocket(port);
00057             byte [] receiveBuf = new byte[0xffff+1];
00058             DatagramPacket receivePacket = new DatagramPacket(receiveBuf, receiveBuf.length);
00059             for (;;) {
00060                 socket.receive(receivePacket);
00061                 // amazingly inefficient code follows (would use StringBuffer,
00062                 // but it doesn't have such a convenient constructor)
00063                 String line = new String(receiveBuf, 0, receivePacket.getLength());
00064                 // Trim whichspace from the right (also, amazingly inefficient code).
00065                 // (String.trim() removes both left and right whitespace).
00066                 while (line.length() > 0 &&
00067                        Character.isWhitespace(line.charAt(line.length()-1))) {
00068                     line = line.substring(0, line.length() - 1);
00069                 }
00070                 System.out.println(receivePacket.getAddress() + ": " + line);
00071             }
00072         } catch (IOException e) {
00073             System.err.println("Reading on port " + port + " got exception: " + e);
00074         }
00075     }

The main entry point. 

00030                                           {
00031 
00032         if (arg.length != 1) {
00033             System.err.println("java echoUDP <port number>");
00034             System.exit(1);
00035         }
00036         
00037         int port = 0;
00038 
00039         try {
00040             port = Integer.parseInt(arg[0].trim());
00041         } catch(NumberFormatException e) {
00042             System.err.println("echoUDP: invalid port number(" + arg[0].trim() + "): " + e);
00043             System.exit(1);
00044         }
00045 
00046         listenOnPort(port);
00047     }
